document_data.name: Teleport gem
document_data.mainbody: A ''teleport gem'' was a device that ''teleported'' the user.
document_data.Powers: ''Teleport gems'' teleported the user to a predetermined location.
document_data.History:
One such teleport gem was owned by [[Florin Falconhand]] in the mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]]; it was keyed to [[Evermeet]], where the elven mother of his child lived.

Another such gem was owned by Queen [[Filfaeryl Obarskyr]] of [[Cormyr]], who refused to use it to transport herself to safety during the ambush in [[Thundaerlyn Hall]], in {{yearlinkName|1373}}, at the hands of [[the Rightful Conspiracy]]. The gem was instead shattered by one of the conspirators while trying to skewer her with a blade.

The mage [[Carmanstos]] of [[Raven's Bluff]] created ''teleport gems'' of his own by imbuing enchantments in gemstones, which released spells when shattered.{{cite organized play/LC/Unfinished Business|7}} Another mage in Raven's Bluff, [[Aleesia]], may have furnished a different kind of ''teleport gem'' to adventurers, possibly a [[silver]] orb which she may have named as a gem by mistake.{{Cite organized play/LC/Stormbreaker}}The teleport gem is not referred to in the text again, and other references are instead to a silver orb that she provides instead, which is missing from the reference to the teleport gem.
